subject: Invitation: Collaborative Neuro-Art Installation at Venice Biennale
body: Innovative Creators, The Neuroaesthetics Collective invites you to participate in "Conscious Canvas" - a groundbreaking art installation fusing brain-computer interfaces with generative AI: Project Overview: » Venue: Central Pavilion, Giardini della Biennale » Technology: ◊ 64-channel EEG headsets capturing neural patterns ◊ Real-time GAN rendering translating brainwaves to visual art ◊ Collective consciousness algorithm merging participant inputs » Participation Mechanics: 1. Neuro-signature capture: 10-min sessions scheduled daily 2. AI processing: StyleGAN3 algorithm creates evolving murals 3. Physical manifestation: Robotic arms paint collective output Your Role Invitation: » Digital Architects (20 needed): - Develop interaction algorithms between EEG inputs - Requires TensorFlow expertise + PyTorch experience » Neuro-Artists (15 positions): - Create base visual templates for GAN transformation - Portfolio review required (submit digital portfolio) » Live Participants (Open registration): - Experience direct brain-to-art creation during exhibition - Priority for contributors to neuro-art forums Compensation & Recognition: » All participants receive named credit in Biennale catalog » Share of net proceeds from NFT derivatives » Cutting-edge neurotech training certification Technical Requirements: » EEG Compatibility: G.TEC Unicorn EEG Suite + OpenBCI » Development Platform: Unity Neural SDK v3.4 » Data Security: GDPR-compliant neural data handling Critical Dates: » Algorithm Submission Deadline: Sep 30 » On-site Integration Testing: Oct 15-28 » Exhibition: Nov 5 - Dec 15 Take Action: 1. Review technical brief: biennale.neuroart.org/specs 2. Submit application: portal.neuroaesthetics.art/Venice2024 3. Join prep community: neuroartcollab.slack.com (invite code: VENICE24) Transform neural electricity into cultural legacy. Limited positions remain.
text: Invitation: Collaborative Neuro-Art Installation at Venice Biennale Innovative Creators, The Neuroaesthetics Collective invites you to participate in "Conscious Canvas" - a groundbreaking art installation fusing brain-computer interfaces with generative AI: Project Overview: » Venue: Central Pavilion, Giardini della Biennale » Technology: ◊ 64-channel EEG headsets capturing neural patterns ◊ Real-time GAN rendering translating brainwaves to visual art ◊ Collective consciousness algorithm merging participant inputs » Participation Mechanics: 1. Neuro-signature capture: 10-min sessions scheduled daily 2. AI processing: StyleGAN3 algorithm creates evolving murals 3. Physical manifestation: Robotic arms paint collective output Your Role Invitation: » Digital Architects (20 needed): - Develop interaction algorithms between EEG inputs - Requires TensorFlow expertise + PyTorch experience » Neuro-Artists (15 positions): - Create base visual templates for GAN transformation - Portfolio review required (submit digital portfolio) » Live Participants (Open registration): - Experience direct brain-to-art creation during exhibition - Priority for contributors to neuro-art forums Compensation & Recognition: » All participants receive named credit in Biennale catalog » Share of net proceeds from NFT derivatives » Cutting-edge neurotech training certification Technical Requirements: » EEG Compatibility: G.TEC Unicorn EEG Suite + OpenBCI » Development Platform: Unity Neural SDK v3.4 » Data Security: GDPR-compliant neural data handling Critical Dates: » Algorithm Submission Deadline: Sep 30 » On-site Integration Testing: Oct 15-28 » Exhibition: Nov 5 - Dec 15 Take Action: 1. Review technical brief: biennale.neuroart.org/specs 2. Submit application: portal.neuroaesthetics.art/Venice2024 3. subject: URGENT: LHC Upgrade Dataset Verification Initiative (CMS Collaboration)
body: Distinguished CMS Members, Following the 14 TeV luminosity upgrade, we've identified systematic discrepancies requiring community-wide dataset verification: Issue Summary: » Tracking efficiency deviation: Pixel detector alignment shows 0.07% offset » Muon reconstruction anomaly: Endcap region efficiency dropped by 1.3% » Jet energy miscalibration: Forward calorimeter response ±5% variation Verification Protocol: 1. Data Sampling: - Download validation dataset: cernbox.cern.ch/Upgrade_Data_v4 - Size: 78TB (compressed root files) - Checksum verification mandatory 2. Analysis Procedures: » Tracking: Validate with Phase-1 alignment constants (attached) » Muon ID: Apply updated selection criteria: cms.cern/muon-selection-2024 » Jets: Use new JEC files: cms.cern/JEC_Fall2024 3. Submission Requirements: - Comparative histograms for standard track reconstruction - RunTheMatrix test results with status flags - Computing resource log (CPU/GPU hours) Resource Allocation: » Priority grid access: CMS Tier-2 sites reserved until Oct 30 » GPU farm scheduling: submit-gpu.cern.ch (use queue "upgrade-verif") » Storage quotas increased by 200TB for verification datasets Consequences of Inaction: - Physics publication moratorium on Run 4 data until resolution - Potential 3-month delay in top quark coupling analysis - Compromise to dark matter search sensitivity goals Required Actions By Oct 10: 1. Dataset verification acknowledgement: cms-logbook.cern.ch/entry?type=verification 2. Assign institutional contact: portal.cms.cern/upgrade-contacts 3. Submit preliminary report: cms.cern/verification-report-form The credibility of high-energy physics depends on our vigilance. Execute with urgency.
text: URGENT: LHC Upgrade Dataset Verification Initiative (CMS Collaboration) Distinguished CMS Members, Following the 14 TeV luminosity upgrade, we've identified systematic discrepancies requiring community-wide dataset verification: Issue Summary: » Tracking efficiency deviation: Pixel detector alignment shows 0.07% offset » Muon reconstruction anomaly: Endcap region efficiency dropped by 1.3% » Jet energy miscalibration: Forward calorimeter response ±5% variation Verification Protocol: 1. Data Sampling: - Download validation dataset: cernbox.cern.ch/Upgrade_Data_v4 - Size: 78TB (compressed root files) - Checksum verification mandatory 2. Analysis Procedures: » Tracking: Validate with Phase-1 alignment constants (attached) » Muon ID: Apply updated selection criteria: cms.cern/muon-selection-2024 » Jets: Use new JEC files: cms.cern/JEC_Fall2024 3. Submission Requirements: - Comparative histograms for standard track reconstruction - RunTheMatrix test results with status flags - Computing resource log (CPU/GPU hours) Resource Allocation: » Priority grid access: CMS Tier-2 sites reserved until Oct 30 » GPU farm scheduling: submit-gpu.cern.ch (use queue "upgrade-verif") » Storage quotas increased by 200TB for verification datasets Consequences of Inaction: - Physics publication moratorium on Run 4 data until resolution - Potential 3-month delay in top quark coupling analysis - Compromise to dark matter search sensitivity goals Required Actions By Oct 10: 1. Dataset verification acknowledgement: cms-logbook.cern.ch/entry?type=verification 2. Assign institutional contact: portal.cms.cern/upgrade-contacts 3. Submit preliminary report: cms.cern/verification-report-form The credibility of high-energy physics depends on our vigilance. Execute with urgency.
